clinical_study.brief_title: Automatic Evaluation of Inflammation Activity in Ulcerative Colitis Using pCLE With Artificial Intelligence
clinical_study.official_title: Automatic Evaluation of Inflammation Activity in Ulcerative Colitis Using Probe-based Confocal Laser Endomicroscopy With Artificial Intelligence

brief_summary.textblock: Probe-based confocal laser endomicroscopy (pCLE) is an endoscopic technique that enables to evaluate the inflammation activity of ulcerative colitis with excellent correlation with histopathology. However this requires much experience, which limits the application of pCLE. The investigators designed a computer-aided diagnosis program using deep neural network to make diagnosis automatically in pCLE examination and contrast its performance with endoscopists.

primary_outcome.measure: The diagnosis efficiency of Artificial Intelligence
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is to test the diagnostic accuracy, sensitivity, specificity, PPV, NPV of the Artificial Intelligence for evaluation of inflammation activity of UC on pCLE examination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Contrast the diagnosis efficiency of Artificial Intelligence with endoscopists
secondary_outcome.description: The secondary outcome is to compare the diagnosis efficiency (including diagnostic accuracy, sensitivity, specificity, PPV, NPV ) between Artificial Intelligence and endoscopists.

arm_group.description: pCLE is used to evaluate the inflammation activity in different parts of the colon mucosa

intervention.intervention_name: The diagnosis of Artificial Intelligence and endoscopist
intervention.description: When the colon mucosa is observed using pCLE, endoscopist and AI will make a diagnosis independently. In addition, the endoscopist can not see the diagnosis of AI.

biospec_descr.textblock: Endoscopist will observe the colon mucosa of UC using pCLE and take biopsy for histology examination.

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive patients who receive the endoscopy pCLE examination and screened that fulfill the eligibility criteria at Qilu Hospital, Shandong University will be enrolled into the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged between 18 and 80; diagnosed as UC
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under conditions unsuitable for performing CLE including coagulopathy , impaired renal or hepatic function, pregnancy or breastfeeding, and known allergy to fluorescein sodium; Inability to provide informed consent

facility.name: Department of Gastroenterology, Qilu Hospital, Shandong University
